subject: Productivity
title: Blue Ocean Strategy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Blue Ocean Strategy.

hook.text: Cirque du Soleil didn't compete with circuses. It created an entirely new market where competition was irrelevant.

buildup.text: Kim and Mauborgne coined Blue Ocean Strategy: create uncontested markets instead of fighting over existing ones.

discovery.text: Red oceans are bloody competition. Blue oceans are new markets with no rivals. The profits are dramatically higher.

twist.text: Creating blue oceans requires eliminating, reducing, raising, and creating factors in a new combination.

climax.text: Nintendo's Wii did this. It didn't compete on graphics. It created a new audience of casual family gamers.

punchline.text: Don't fight for market share. Create a new market.

quiz.question: What is a blue ocean strategy?
options: Creating uncontested market space instead of competing in existing ones
Expanding into every possible market simultaneously
